about.summary: Obtain any major version of 'jQuery' (<https://code.jquery.com/>) and use it in any webpage generated by 'htmltools' (e.g. 'shiny', 'htmlwidgets', and 'rmarkdown'). Most R users don't need to use this package directly, but other R packages (e.g. 'shiny', 'rmarkdown', etc.) depend on this package to avoid bundling redundant copies of 'jQuery'.

name: r-jquerylib
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-jquerylib
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/jquerylib_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/jquerylib/jquerylib_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: dad3d1fde4e92cfeaf0f699f7db8ab4930cdef093573abbab589dbea4c4ff86a

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{posix}}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-htmltools
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-htmltools

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('jquerylib')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('jquerylib')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=jquerylib
  license: MIT
  summary: Obtain any major version of 'jQuery' (<https://code.jquery.com/>) and use it in any
    webpage generated by 'htmltools' (e.g. 'shiny', 'htmlwidgets', and 'rmarkdown').
    Most R users don't need to use this package directly, but other R packages (e.g.
    'shiny', 'rmarkdown', etc.) depend on this package to avoid bundling redundant copies
    of 'jQuery'.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE
    - inst/lib/LICENSE.txt

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - halldc

# Package: jquerylib
# Title: Obtain 'jQuery' as an HTML Dependency Object
# Version: 0.1
# Authors@R: c( person("Carson", "Sievert", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "carson@rstudio.com", comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-4958-2844")), person("Joe", "Cheng", role = "aut", email = "joe@rstudio.com"), person(family = "RStudio", role = "cph"), person(family = "jQuery Foundation", role = "cph", comment = "jQuery library and jQuery UI library"), person(family = "jQuery contributors", role = c("ctb", "cph"), comment = "jQuery library; authors listed in inst/lib/jquery-AUTHORS.txt") )
# Description: Obtain any major version of 'jQuery' (<https://code.jquery.com/>) and use it in any webpage generated by 'htmltools' (e.g. 'shiny', 'htmlwidgets', and 'rmarkdown'). Most R users don't need to use this package directly, but other R packages (e.g. 'shiny', 'rmarkdown', etc.) depend on this package to avoid bundling redundant copies of 'jQuery'.
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 7.0.2
# Imports: htmltools
# Suggests: testthat
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2020-03-11 17:11:21 UTC; cpsievert
# Author: Carson Sievert [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4958-2844>), Joe Cheng [aut], RStudio [cph], jQuery Foundation [cph] (jQuery library and jQuery UI library), jQuery contributors [ctb, cph] (jQuery library; authors listed in inst/lib/jquery-AUTHORS.txt)
# Maintainer: Carson Sievert <carson@rstudio.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2020-03-19 16:50:02 UTC
